summary: In December 1989, the U.S. invaded Panama to remove General Manuel Noriega, who was wanted for drug trafficking. The operation, called Operation Just Cause, ended in January 1990 with Noriega's surrender. He was then sent to the U.S. for trial. The invasion followed years of deteriorating relations between Noriega and the U.S. Panama's elected president, Guillermo Endara, took office after the invasion. Despite international criticism, the U.S. action led to long-term democracy in Panama.
title: United States invasion of Panama
